intro: Hamosa bruceae, commonly known as Bruce's hamosa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and Botswana. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from pale yellow to reddish-brown. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
